title: Sri Lanka’s Litro raises LP gas price to record high
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s state-run Litro Gas Company Ltd increased the 12.5kg gas cylinder price by around 45 percent to a record high of 4,860 rupees effective from April 26, a statement by the company said.
Litro raised the prices last in October 2021 to 2,675 rupees from 1,493 rupees.
Litro rejected claims of a price hike up to 5175 rupees on April 22.

Litro sought approval on March 31 from the cabinet to raise gas prices to sponge 4.2 billion rupee loss it had made since the rupee was floated on March 7. The rupee has fallen around 70 percent since then.

Laugfs, the private-gas supplier that controls 20 percent of the market share increased the price of 12.5kg cylinder for the third time since August 2021 record to levels in March – raising by 48 percent or 1,359 rupees to 4,199. It raised 5kg gas cylinder price by 544 rupees to 1,680 rupees. (Colombo/April27/2022)
